<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.1
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>a12-15894_1ex99d1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-99.1  PRESS RELEASE DATED JULY 19, 2012
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body lang="EN-US">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 2.0in;text-align:right;"><b><font
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Exhibit 99.1</font></b></p>
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 2.0in;text-align:right;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="725" height="183" 
src="g158941mm01i001.jpg" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></p>
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For immediate 
release</font></p>
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Nexen
Announces Continued Progress on Strategic Initiatives&nbsp;&amp; Solid Second
Quarter Results</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
style:italic;">Performance at Buzzard&nbsp;&amp; Usan Drives Increased 
Production and Cash Flow</font></i></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Calgary, Alberta, July&nbsp;19, 2012 
</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;<b>  </b>Nexen Inc. 
(TSX, NYSE: NXY) today reported second quarter 2012 operating and financial 
results and provided an update on strategic priorities.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Production volumes averaged 213,000 barrels of oil 
equivalent per day (boe/d), a 5% increase from the first quarter. These volumes 
reflected the ramp-up of our Usan project offshore West Africa and solid 
performance from our UK assets, in particular the Buzzard platform. Cash flow 
from operations was up 6% to $707 million ($1.34/share) as we recognized the 
first cash flow from Usan and continued to benefit from our exposure to Brent-
priced oil and strong cash netbacks. Net income decreased 36% from the prior 
quarter to $109 million ($0.20/share) primarily due to the previously announced 
unsuccessful Kakuna exploration well in the Gulf of Mexico.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We continue to make good progress on several of our 
strategic priorities:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Buzzard operations were very strong; the facility produced 194,000
boe/d (84,000 boe/d net to Nexen) with a production efficiency of 88%, which 
exceeded our target of 85%.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Usan continues to ramp-up and is currently producing over 100,000 
barrels per day (bbls/d) (20,000 bbls/d net to Nexen) from the initial 
production wells.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">In the Gulf of Mexico, we continue to be excited by our success at
Appomattox. We recently completed a successful appraisal well in the south fault
block of the structure and the preliminary indications are that we are near the 
upper end of our expectations. Next, we plan on drilling a sidetrack to test 
additional resource potential in the northwest fault block.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">We also continue to progress our exploration program elsewhere, 
with drilling operations underway on the North Uist well in the UK North Sea and
the Owowo West well, offshore West Africa.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2"
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">We achieved first production from pad 12 at Long Lake and began 
steaming pad 13 ahead of expectations; these pads are expected to produce 
11,000-17,000 bbls/d of gross bitumen production following an 18 to 24 month 
ramp-up.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;I&#146;m pleased that we continue to make 
significant progress against our milestones and that we&#146;ve generated solid 
financial results over the past few quarters,&#148; said Kevin Reinhart, 
Nexen&#146;s interim President&nbsp;&amp; CEO. &#147;A renewed focus on 
operational excellence has allowed us to meet our production guidance again this
quarter, and our growth plans are also advancing, with important progress at 
Long Lake, on-going success at Appomattox and a couple of exciting exploration 
wells underway.&#148;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1<a 
name="PB_1_141140_7056"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\JMS\105577\12-15894-1\task5439116\15894-1-mm-

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Operational Update</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">Conventional</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Offshore West Africa</font></i><font
size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; Oil production from Usan started 
February&nbsp;24 on block OML-138, offshore Nigeria. Seven wells are now on-
stream and since late April, production rates have averaged between 100,000 and 
110,000 bbls/d (20,000-22,000 bbls/d net to Nexen). We expect to bring on 
additional producing wells later this year.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July, we spudded an exploration well at Owowo West 
on block OPL-223 and expect to reach target depth there this fall. This well is 
in close proximity to our oil discovery at Owowo South B.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">UK North Sea</font></i><font 
size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; Buzzard production efficiency was 
strong in the second quarter at 88%, calculated using an assumed maximum 
production rate of 220,000 boe/d. This exceeds our target of 85% efficiency, 
excluding planned downtime.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We plan to begin the scheduled major vessel inspection
and turnaround at Buzzard in the first week of September. Production will be 
shut-in for several weeks as the work is completed; the facility is expected to 
return to full rates by mid-October.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recently drilled a successful appraisal well in the
Northern Terrace area of the Buzzard field. We are currently testing our 
discovery there and plan to sidetrack to assess the resource size.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">At Telford, we saw very good rates from the TAC 
tieback in the second half of the quarter as we worked through minor facility 
issues encountered during start-up.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Golden Eagle development continues to progress 
towards first oil in late 2014. The fabrication of the platform facilities is 
well underway; construction is on time and on budget.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Drilling is underway on our North Uist exploration 
prospect, which is located to the west of the Shetland Islands. Results from the
BP-operated well are expected in the third quarter.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gulf of Mexico</font></i><font 
size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; Our top priority in the Gulf of 
Mexico is continuing our exploration and appraisal program in the Norphlet play 
along with our partner, Shell Gulf of Mexico Inc.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">To date, we have booked 65 million barrels of probable
reserves in the south fault block of the Appomattox structure and added 50 
million barrels of net contingent resource in the northeast fault block. We 
further delineated the south fault block during the second quarter with an 
appraisal well that encountered over 400 feet of net true vertical thickness oil
pay and confirmed excellent reservoir quality. This well came in at the high end
of our expectations and as a result, it could have a positive impact on our 
probable reserves.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have five more exploration and appraisal targets in
the Norphlet play that we plan to test over the next twelve months, 
including:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">A sidetrack from the recently completed appraisal well to test 
incremental resource potential in the northwest fault block of the Appomattox 
structure.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2"
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">An exploration well targeting a structure between Appomattox and 
our prior discovery at Vicksburg.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">A sidetrack from that well to further appraise the northeast fault
block.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Two nearby exploration wells at Petersburg and Rydberg.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">These wells will allow us to progress a development 
plan for Appomattox and continue to test the potential of the significant 
acreage position we have accumulated in the area.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a 20% interest in Appomattox, a 25% interest 
in Vicksburg and similar interests in numerous other blocks in the Norphlet 
play. The remaining interests are held by Shell, who is the operator.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2<a 
name="PB_2_141221_5335"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\105577\12-15894-1\task5439116\15894-1-mm-
01.htm',USER='105577',CD='Jul 19 05:43 2012' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Oil 
Sands</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Long Lake &#151;</font></i><font 
size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Production from Long Lake was 33,700 bbls/d 
(gross) at a steam-oil-ratio of 5.0. Production was down slightly from 34,500 
bbls/d in the first quarter as growth from pad 11 was offset by steam outages 
and well downtime, primarily during April. Production in May&nbsp;and 
June&nbsp;averaged 35,400 bbls/d (gross).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">At pad 11, recent weekly averages have been about 
6,000 bbls/d and we expect those rates to continue to increase going 
forward.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">At pad 12, we are currently producing from four of the
nine wells. The remaining wells are expected to be converted from circulation to
production over the next few weeks. Pad 12 started production ahead of schedule 
due to new completion techniques and processes that will now be standard for 
future wells. The nine wells on pad 13 also began steaming ahead of schedule, 
primarily as a result of the efficiency of steam utilization on the pad 12 
start-up.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">A major turnaround beginning in mid-August&nbsp;will 
result in lower third quarter production rates compared to the first and second 
quarters of this year. Due to the turnaround, we expect approximately three 
weeks of SAGD downtime and six weeks of upgrader downtime.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Once the turnaround has been completed, we expect 
production to resume an upward trend. Steam injection is currently at record 
levels of about 190,000 bbls/d; we are directing this steam to the best 
available resource. We expect our year-end exit rate to be strong with pad 11 
growth, the ramp-up of pads 12 and 13, and improved facility operations 
following the turnaround. We also have a few infill wells and re-drills that 
will start to contribute to production in the fourth quarter.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upgrader yield (PSC</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">TM</font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">&#160;barrels per barrel of bitumen) was 74% and facility on-
stream time (percent of available bitumen processed) was 90%. Per-barrel 
operating costs were consistent with the prior quarter. Following the 
turnaround, we expect operating costs to decrease on a per-barrel basis as 
production increases. Lower oil prices and production resulted in a reduction in
cash flow from the prior quarter.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Long 
Lake Quarterly Operating Metrics</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-
collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
<tr>
<td width="24%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:24.74%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="black" 
style="background:white;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.96%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Bitumen<br>   Production (Gross)</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.96%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Steam<br>   Injection (Gross)</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.96%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Unit<br>   Operating Cost</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-
size:5.0pt;font-weight:bold;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">1</font></b></p>    
</td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.96%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Cash<br>   Flow</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.96%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We continue to make good progress towards filling the 
upgrader with additional wells in good-quality resource. We expect to begin 
drilling on pads 14, 15 and Kinosis 1A over the next several weeks. Together 
with the existing producing wells, we anticipate these wells will allow us to 
fill the upgrader over the next few years:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="93%" style="border-
collapse:collapse;margin-left:.25in;width:93.28%;">
<tr>
<td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.06%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid 
windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.18%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Number&nbsp;of&nbsp;Wells</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="25%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid 
windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:25.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Expected&nbsp;Peak&nbsp;Rates<br>   bbls/d</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-

<td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid 
windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.52%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Timing</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="16%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.06%;">

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>
<td width="25%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:25.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11,000 - 
17,000</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>
<td width="34%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.52%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ramp-up over next 18-
24 months</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="16%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.06%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pads   14&nbsp;&amp; 15</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="16%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.18%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,000 - 
7,000</font></p>    </td>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>
<td width="34%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.52%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Steam in second half 
of 2013</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="16%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.06%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kinosis   1A</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="16%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.18%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>
<td width="25%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:25.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15,000 - 
25,000</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>
<td width="34%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.52%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Steam in 
2014</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nexen has a 65% working interest in both Long Lake and
Kinosis and is the operator. CNOOC Canada Inc. holds a 35% working interest in 
both Long Lake and Kinosis.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Shale 
Gas</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Northeast British Columbia 
&#151;</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Our previously 
announced joint venture agreement with INPEX and JGC is now expected to close 
before the end of July. All conditions of the transaction are expected to be met
next week.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are finalizing the completion activities on an 18-
well pad in the Horn River. The pad is slated to come on-stream in the fourth 
quarter, concurrent with the facility expansion which will increase our 
production capacity to about 175 million cubic feet per day (mmcf/d) from 
approximately 50 mmcf/d. Lease earning activities are also commencing on our 
Liard acreage. Nexen and INPEX plan to develop our significant shale gas 
resource as economic conditions permit. We have also agreed to jointly 
investigate the feasibility of LNG export opportunities.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Production Summary</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">213</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>

style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 
1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">180</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>
</table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Production increased 5% from the first quarter on a 
before-royalties basis and 8% on an after-royalties basis. The increase was 
primarily driven by the ramp-up of Usan and good performance from the Buzzard 
field. Those increases were offset by a longer than expected turnaround at 
Syncrude and lower rates at Longhorn in the Gulf of Mexico.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4<a 
name="PB_4_142034_2897"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\105577\12-15894-1\task5439116\15894-1-mm-
01.htm',USER='105577',CD='Jul 19 05:43 2012' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Guidance Update</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Production of 213,000 boe/d met our guidance of 
190,000 to 235,000 boe/d.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are on-track to meet our third and fourth quarter 
production guidance, with Buzzard, Usan and Long Lake continuing to be the 
critical drivers of our guidance ranges.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Average Daily Production before Royalties</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    
</td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="21%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.0%;">

style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">202</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">213</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">~190   - 235</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">~160   - 190</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">~205   - 240</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-
weight:bold;">~185 </font></i></b><b><i><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">-</font></i></b><b><i><font 
size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> 
220</font></i></b></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">At Buzzard, production will be primarily driven by 
production efficiency and the length of the turnaround. We expect that total 
planned shutdown days for the year will fall within our guidance of 29 to 42 
days.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also have downtime on the Scott platform planned 
for the third quarter. This will allow us to prepare the tie-in of the Rochelle 
facilities and complete regular platform maintenance. Rochelle is expected to be
on-stream around the end of the year.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">At Usan, the primary drivers of production will 
continue to be the timing of new well start-ups and overall well 
performance.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The primary factors affecting Long Lake production for
the third quarter are well performance and the length of the planned turnaround.
Our guidance reflects three weeks of production downtime related to the 
turnaround. In the fourth quarter, production should reflect facility 
improvements made during the turnaround as well as growing production from pads
11, 12 and 13.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5<a 
name="PB_5_142328_3020"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>

<td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.86%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,449</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.68%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.86%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,838</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.06%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade 
color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1. Cash netback is defined as 
our corporate average cash netback from oil and gas operations, after-
tax.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2. For reconciliation of this 
non-GAAP measure, see Cash Flow from Operations on pg. 10.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">3. Includes geological and geophysical 
expenditures.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">4. Net debt is defined as long-term debt and short-
term borrowings less cash and cash equivalents.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The second quarter financial results were strong, as 
the contribution from Usan and higher production volumes more than offset lower 
oil prices. Cash netbacks were fairly consistent with the first quarter as 
growth in our high-netback Usan production offset lower oil prices. This, 
combined with higher production, resulted in cash flow from operations 
increasing 6% compared to the prior quarter.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">We continue to realize financial benefits from 
shipping oil off the west coast of Canada under the long-term contract we 
secured at the beginning of this year. During the quarter, our export capacity 
to the west coast of Canada generated approximately $34 million of incremental 
cash flow, a benefit which we expect to continue as long as Brent trades at a 
premium to North American crudes. Year-to-date, we have generated more than $70 
million of cash flow from this source.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net income declined to $109 million from $171 million 
in the first quarter due to the charge for the previously announced unsuccessful
Kakuna exploration well.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net debt decreased slightly compared to the first 
quarter. We expect to receive cash from our shale gas joint venture in the third
quarter. This may be partially offset by capital expenditures exceeding cash 
flow, depending on oil prices.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Quarterly Dividends</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors has declared the regular 
quarterly dividend of $0.05 per common share payable October&nbsp;1, 2012, to 
shareholders of record on September&nbsp;10, 2012.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has also declared the quarterly dividend on 
our Series&nbsp;2 Preferred Shares of $0.3125 per share payable 
September&nbsp;30, 2012 to shareholders of record on September&nbsp;10, 
2012.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6<a 
name="PB_6_143115_7748"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade
color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">About</font></b><b><font size="2" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> Nexen</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nexen Inc. is an independent, Canadian-based global 
energy company, listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the 
symbol NXY. Nexen is focused on three growth strategies: oil sands and shale gas
in western Canada and conventional exploration and development primarily in the 
North Sea, offshore West Africa and deepwater Gulf of Mexico. Nexen adds value 
for shareholders through successful full-cycle oil and gas exploration and 
development, and leadership in ethics, integrity, governance and environmental 
stewardship.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">For </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">further information on our shale gas joint venture, please refer 
to our press release dated November&nbsp;29, 2011. For more information on our 
estimates of reserves, please refer to our 2011 Annual Information Form. For 
more information on our estimates of resource, please refer to our press 
releases dated November&nbsp;15, 2010 and April&nbsp;2, 2012.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward-Looking 
Statements</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Certain statements in this Release 
constitute &#147;forward-looking statements&#148; (within the meaning of the 
</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">United States Private 
Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995<i>, as amended) or &#147;forward-
looking information&#148; (within the meaning of applicable Canadian securities 
legislation). Such statements or information (together &#147;forward-looking 
statements&#148;) are generally identifiable by the forward-looking terminology 
used such as &#147;anticipate&#148;, &#147;believe&#148;, &#147;intend&#148;, 
&#147;plan&#148;, &#147;expect&#148;, &#147;estimate&#148;, &#147;budget&#148;, 
&#147;outlook&#148;, &#147;forecast&#148; or other similar words and include 
statements relating to or associated with individual wells, regions or projects.
Any statements as to possible future crude oil or natural gas prices; future 
production levels; future royalties and tax levels; future capital expenditures,
their timing and their allocation to exploration and development activities; 
future earnings; future asset acquisitions or dispositions; future sources of 
funding for our capital program; future debt levels; availability of committed 
credit facilities; possible commerciality of our projects; development plans or 
capacity expansions; the expectation that we have the ability to substantially 
grow production at our oil sands facilities through controlled expansions; the 
expectation of achieving the production design rates from our oil sands 
facilities; the expectation that our oil sands production facilities continue to
develop better and more sustainable practices; the expectation of cheaper and 
more technologically advanced operations; the expected design size of our 
facilities; the expected timing and associated production impact of facility 
turnarounds and maintenance; the expectation that we can continue to operate our
offshore exploration, development and production facilities safely and 
profitably; future ability to execute dispositions of assets or businesses; 
future sources of liquidity, cash flows and their uses; future drilling of new 
wells; ultimate recoverability of current and long-term assets; ultimate 
recoverability of reserves or resources; expected finding and development costs;
expected operating costs; future cost recovery oil revenues from our Yemen 
operations; the expectation of our ability to comply with the new safety and
environmental rules&nbsp;enacted in the US at a minimal incremental cost, and of
receiving necessary drilling permits for our US offshore operations; estimates 
on a per share basis; future foreign currency exchange rates; future 
expenditures and future allowances relating to environmental matters and our 
ability to comply with them; dates by which certain areas will be developed, 
come on stream or reach expected operating capacity; and changes in any of the 
foregoing are forward-looking statements.</i></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Statements relating to 
&#147;reserves&#148; or &#147;resources&#148; are forward-looking statements, as
they involve the implied assessment, based on estimates and assumptions that the
reserves and resources described exist in the quantities predicted or estimated 
and can be profitably produced in the future.</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">All of the forward-looking 
statements in this Release are qualified by the assumptions that are stated or 
inherent in such forward-looking statements. Although we believe that these 
assumptions are reasonable based on the information available to us on the date 
such assumptions were made, this list is not exhaustive of the factors that may 
affect any of the forward-looking statements and the reader should not place an 
undue reliance on these assumptions and such forward-looking statements. The key
assumptions that have been made in connection with the forward-looking 
statements include the following: that we will conduct our operations and 
achieve results of operations as anticipated; that our development plans will 
achieve the expected results; the general continuance of current or, where 
applicable, assumed industry conditions; the continuation of assumed tax, 
royalty and regulatory regimes; the accuracy of the estimates of our reserve 
volumes; commodity price and cost assumptions; the continued availability of 
adequate cash flow and debt and/or equity financing to fund our capital and 
operating requirements as needed; and the extent of our liabilities. We believe 
the material factors, expectations and assumptions reflected in the forward-
looking statements are reasonable, but no assurance can be given that these 
factors, expectations and assumptions will prove to be correct.</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Forward-looking statements are 
subject to known and unknown risks and uncertainties and other factors, many of 
which are beyond our control and each of which contributes to the possibility 
that our forward-looking statements will not occur or that actual results, 
levels of activity and achievements may differ materially from those expressed 
or implied by such statements. Such factors include, among others: market prices
for oil and gas; our ability to explore, develop, produce, upgrade and transport
crude oil and natural gas to markets; ultimate effectiveness of design or design
modifications to facilities; the results of exploration and development drilling
and related activities; the cumulative impact of oil sands development on the 
environment; the impact of technology on operations and processes and how new 
complex technology may not perform as expected; the availability of pipeline and
global refining capacity; risks inherent to the operations of any large, complex
refinery units, especially the integration between production operations and an 
upgrader facility; availability of third-party bitumen for use in our oil sands 
production facilities; labour and material shortages; risks related to 
accidents, blowouts and spills in connection with our offshore exploration, 
development and production activities, particularly our deep-water activities; 
direct and indirect risks related to the imposition of moratoriums, suspensions 
or cancellations of our offshore exploration, development and production 
operations, particularly our deep-water activities; the impact&#160; of severe 
weather on our offshore exploration, development and production activities, 
particularly our deep-water activities; the effectiveness and reliability of our
technology in harsh and unpredictable environments; risks related to the actions
and financial circumstances of our agents and contractors, counterparties and 
joint venture partners; volatility in energy trading markets; foreign currency 
exchange rates; economic conditions in the countries and regions in which we 
carry on business; governmental actions including changes to taxes or royalties,
changes in environmental and other laws and regulations including without 
limitation, those related to our offshore exploration, development and 
production activities; renegotiations of contracts; results of litigation, 
arbitration or regulatory proceedings; political uncertainty, including actions 
by terrorists, insurgent or other groups, or other armed conflict, including 
conflict between states; and other factors, many of which are beyond our 
control.</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">These risks, uncertainties and other
factors and their possible impact are discussed more fully in the sections 
titled &#147;Risk Factors&#148; in our 2011 Annual Information Form&nbsp;and 
&#147;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk&#148; in our 
2011 annual MD&amp;A. The impact of any one risk, uncertainty or factor on a 
particular forward-looking statement is not determinable with certainty as these
factors are interdependent, and management&#146;s future course of action would 
depend on our assessment of all information at that time. Although we believe 
that the expectations conveyed by the forward-looking statements are reasonable 
based on information available to us on the date such forward-looking statements
were made, no assurances can be given as to future results, levels of activity 
and achievements. Undue reliance should not be placed on the forward-looking 
statements contained herein, which are made as of the date hereof as the plans, 
intentions, assumptions or expectations upon which they are based might not 
occur or come to fruition. Except as required by applicable securities laws, 
Nexen undertakes no obligation to update publicly or revise any forward-looking 
statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. 
Included herein is information that may be considered financial outlook and/or 
future-oriented financial information (FOFI). Its purpose is to indicate the 
potential results of our intentions and may not be appropriate for other 
purposes. The forward-looking statements contained herein are expressly 
qualified by this cautionary statement.</font></i></p>

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Note to Investors 
on Reserves and Resources</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The reserves estimates in this 
disclosure were prepared with an effective date of December&nbsp;31, 2011.&#160;
The resource estimates were prepared on March&nbsp;31, 2012.&#160; These 
estimates have been internally prepared by an internal qualified reserves 
evaluator in accordance with National Instrument 51-101 Standards of Disclosure 
for Oil and Gas Activities (&#147;NI 51-101&#148;) and the Canadian Oil and Gas 
Evaluation Handbook (&#147;COGE Handbook&#148;). For more information on this
reserves estimate and Nexen&#146;s reserves estimation process please refer to 
our 2011 Annual Information Form. For more information on our Appomattox 
resource estimate please refer to our press release dated April&nbsp;2, 2012. 
Both our Annual Information Form&nbsp;and news releases are available at 
www.nexeninc.com and www.sedar.com.</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Conversions of gas volumes to boe in
these estimates were made on the basis of 1 boe to 6 mcf of natural gas. A boe 
conversion ratio of 6 mcf:1 bbl is based on an energy equivalency conversion 
method primarily applicable at the burner tip and does not represent a value 
equivalency at the wellhead. Using the forecast prices applied to our reserves 
estimates, the boe conversion ratio based on wellhead value is approximately 30 
mcf:1 bbl. Disclosure provided herein in respect of boes may be misleading, 
particularly if used in isolation.</font></i></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9<a 
name="PB_9_143304_8146"></a></font></p>

width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Includes results of discontinued operations. See Note 23 of our 
2011 Annual Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Includes oil and gas development, exploration, and expenditures 
for other property, plant and equipment.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Net debt is defined as long-term debt and short-term borrowings 
less cash and cash equivalents.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash Flow from Operations

weight:bold;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">1</font></b></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext

face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,377</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

<td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.5%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,267</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><hr size="1" 
width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Defined as cash flow from operating activities before changes in 
non-cash working capital and other. We evaluate our performance and that of our 
business segments based on earnings and cash flow from operations. Cash flow 
from operations is a non-GAAP term that represents cash generated from operating
activities before changes in non-cash working capital and other. We consider it 
a key measure as it demonstrates our ability to generate the cash flow necessary
to fund future growth through capital investment. Cash flow from operations may 
not be comparable with the calculation of similar measures for other 
companies.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-
collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
<tr>
<td width="36%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:36.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="35%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-
bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:35.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">We have presented production volumes before royalties as we 
measure our performance on this basis consistent with other Canadian oil and gas
companies.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 13.7pt;text-indent:-13.7pt;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Includes shale gas production in Canada.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Other Countries consists of production in Nigeria, Yemen and 
Colombia.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">4&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">We report Long Lake bitumen as production.</font></p>

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><hr size="1" 
width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Netbacks are defined as average sales price less royalties, other 
operating costs and in-country taxes.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Excludes activities related to third-party bitumen purchased, 
processed and sold.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12<a 
name="PB_12_023551_5796"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
color="#010101" align="left"></div>

05.htm',USER='105571',CD='Jul 19 05:43 2012' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Netbacks are defined as average sales price less royalties and 
other, operating costs and in-country taxes.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Includes </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Canadian 
conventional, CBM and shale gas activities. Shale gas was included beginning in 
the fourth quarter of 2011 when it became commercial</font><font size="2" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="1" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">Other Countries relates to Yemen, Colombia and West 
Africa.</font></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Nexen Inc.</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Unaudited Condensed Consolidated 
Balance Sheet</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-
collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
<tr>
<td width="70%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">June&nbsp;30</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">

face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">1&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net 
of income tax recovery for the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 of $5 
million (2011 &#150; net of income tax expense of $11 million) and net of income
tax recovery for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 of $7 million (2011 
&#150; net of income tax expense of $20 million).</font></p>
